title: Gather Requirements
description: Collaborate with stakeholders and conduct user research to define the scope, goals, and functional requirements for the CrossSkillMatchmaker system. Identify key features, data needs, and potential integrations with existing systems. document use cases and edge cases.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the system, including components, data flow, integration points, and key considerations for maintainability, scalability, and performance. The design should also include a clear separation of frontend and backend, with a focus on microservices architecture where appropriate. Additionally, consider integrating machine learning algorithms to improve the accuracy of skill-building opportunity suggestions.

title: Develop Data Model
description: Design and implement the data model for storing employee profiles, skills, interests, and organizational needs.

title: Implement Matching Algorithm
description: Develop the core algorithm for matching employee interests and skills with organizational needs.

title: Build User Interface
description: Design and develop the user interface for employees and administrators to interact with the system.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the system follows best practices for data security, access control, and user authentication.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Configure a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deploying the application.

title: Write Documentation
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the system, including user guides, technical specifications, and maintenance procedures.

title: Conduct Testing
description: Plan and execute various types of testing, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing.

title: Deploy and Monitor
description: Deploy the system to production and set up monitoring and logging mechanisms for performance and issue tracking.
dependencies: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
